intro: Senghasia parvilabris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved senghasia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Senghasia parvilabris is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
